 164:                                        double *W,
 165:                                        cnp.npy_intp *IN) nogil:
 166:     ''' Interpolate in 3d volumes given point X
 167: 
 168:     Returns
 169:     -------
 170:     W : weights
 171:     IN : indices of the volume
 172:     '''
 173:     cdef double Xf[3], d[3], nd[3]
 174:     cdef cnp.npy_intp i
 175:     # define the rectangular box where every corner is a neighboring voxel
 176:     # (assuming center) !!! this needs to change for the affine case
+177:     for i from 0 <= i < 3:
  for (__pyx_v_i = 0; __pyx_v_i < 3; __pyx_v_i++) {

+178:         Xf[i] = floor(X[i])
    (__pyx_v_Xf[__pyx_v_i]) = floor((__pyx_v_X[__pyx_v_i]));

+179:         d[i] = X[i] - Xf[i]
    (__pyx_v_d[__pyx_v_i]) = ((__pyx_v_X[__pyx_v_i]) - (__pyx_v_Xf[__pyx_v_i]));

+180:         nd[i] = 1 - d[i]
    (__pyx_v_nd[__pyx_v_i]) = (1.0 - (__pyx_v_d[__pyx_v_i]));
  }

 181:     # weights
 182:     # the weights are actualy the volumes of the 8 smaller boxes that define
 183:     # the initial rectangular box for more on trilinear have a look here
 184:     # http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilinear_interpolation
 185:     # http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/miscellaneous/interpolation/index.html
+186:     W[0]=nd[0] * nd[1] * nd[2]
  (__pyx_v_W[0]) = (((__pyx_v_nd[0]) * (__pyx_v_nd[1])) * (__pyx_v_nd[2]));

+187:     W[1]= d[0] * nd[1] * nd[2]
  (__pyx_v_W[1]) = (((__pyx_v_d[0]) * (__pyx_v_nd[1])) * (__pyx_v_nd[2]));

+188:     W[2]=nd[0] *  d[1] * nd[2]
  (__pyx_v_W[2]) = (((__pyx_v_nd[0]) * (__pyx_v_d[1])) * (__pyx_v_nd[2]));

+189:     W[3]=nd[0] * nd[1] *  d[2]
  (__pyx_v_W[3]) = (((__pyx_v_nd[0]) * (__pyx_v_nd[1])) * (__pyx_v_d[2]));

+190:     W[4]= d[0] *  d[1] * nd[2]
  (__pyx_v_W[4]) = (((__pyx_v_d[0]) * (__pyx_v_d[1])) * (__pyx_v_nd[2]));

+191:     W[5]=nd[0] *  d[1] *  d[2]

 196:     # of the box) e.g. the qa coordinates
